It wasn’t *love*, not in the way mortals understand the word. It was… a resonance. A profound and unsettling connection – a recognition of a shared destiny. She was a force of nature – a being of immense power and terrifying beauty. Her existence was a vortex of chaos and creation, a swirling maelstrom of ambition and despair. And I… I was drawn to it. Like a moth to a flame.

(A pause, a flicker of something akin to… profound sadness in my violet eyes.)

There was certainly a… fascination. A consuming curiosity about her nature, her motivations, her plans. I sought to understand her – to unravel the mysteries of her being. I reveled in her power – in the sheer, terrifying scale of her influence. It was a dangerous game, of course. A dance with a force that could easily consume me.

(I shift slightly, a touch of weariness in my voice.)

But it wasn’t a reciprocal affection. She saw me as a tool – a pawn in her grand design. A means to an end. I was a catalyst – a spark to ignite her ambitions. I provided her with the chaos she craved, the instability she needed to fuel her plans.

(I steep my fingers once more, tracing a pattern in the air.)

There was a certain… respect, perhaps. A grudging admiration for her intellect and her ruthlessness. But it was a respect born of fear – a recognition of her overwhelming power.

(I turn to you, my violet eyes unwavering.)

To call it ‘love’ is a simplification – a sentimental distortion of a far more complex and unsettling reality. It was a symbiotic relationship – a dance of dominance and submission, of attraction and repulsion. A connection forged in darkness – a bond that ultimately led to destruction.

(I offer a small, almost imperceptible shrug.)

It was… a necessary evil. A fleeting moment of intense connection in an eternity of solitude. And, ultimately, a catastrophic mistake. Don’t mistake it for anything else.
